Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of an orange-red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393279) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393279)
